EQT.name: EQT Partners
EQT.description: EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and global reach, EQT has approximately EUR 220 billion in total assets under management across multiple strategies including Private Capital, Real Assets, and Credit.

team.name: Caspar Callerström
team.title: Deputy CEO and Head of Private Capital

EQT.recent_activity: Q3 2024: EQT XI Fund closed at €22B (largest European PE fund ever). Recent deals: Zeus Healthcare acquisition (€2.1B), Sitecore software investment (€1.8B), Waystar healthcare tech exit (€3.2B). New office opened in Singapore. Sustainability initiatives: 50% portfolio companies carbon neutral by 2025. Team expansion: 50+ new hires across all offices. Strong portfolio performance: 25% IRR across Fund X investments. Exploring AI and climate tech opportunities.

Nordic Capital.name: Nordic Capital
Nordic Capital.description: Nordic Capital is a leading private equity investor in the Nordic region with a strong track record in healthcare, technology & payments, financial services, and services & industrial tech. The firm has raised eleven funds with total commitments of EUR 35 billion.

team.name: Frederik Näs
team.title: Managing Partner and Head of Healthcare

Nordic Capital.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Nordic Capital Fund XI closed at €7.5B (oversubscribed by 50%). Recent exits: Parexel sold to EQT (€2.8B), Cerba HealthCare to KKR (€1.9B). New investments: Ellab healthcare monitoring (€400M), Inexto technology platform (€300M). Team growth: 15 new partners across Nordic offices. Sustainability focus: 100% portfolio ESG integration. Strong performance: Fund X showing 28% IRR. Exploring AI healthcare and fintech opportunities. New Copenhagen office expansion planned.

Triton Partners.name: Triton Partners
Triton Partners.description: Triton is a leading European private equity firm investing in medium-sized businesses in Northern Europe. The firm focuses on building sustainable value through operational improvements and strategic development.
Triton Partners.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Major portfolio restructuring: Assemblin Caverion Group formation (€2.1B combined entity), IFCO exit to KKR (€1.2B). New investments: Acre Security acquisition (€800M), Bergman Clinics expansion (€300M). Fund V deployment: 60% committed across 8 platform investments. Team expansion: 20 new hires across European offices. Sustainability initiatives: 30% portfolio companies carbon neutral. Strong performance: Fund IV showing 22% IRR. Exploring industrial tech and healthcare opportunities. New Munich office opened.

Altor.name: Altor Equity Partners
Altor.description: Altor is a private equity firm focused on upper mid-cap transformational investments across the Nordics, DACH and Benelux. Distinctive themes include digital/AI transformation, energy transition and decarbonisation, with growing global partnerships (e.g., WovenLight AI lab).

fundraising.strategy: Upper mid-cap transformational PE; Nordic + DACH + Benelux; partnerships with WovenLight AI

Litorina.name: Litorina
Litorina.description: Litorina is a Swedish private equity firm investing in medium-sized Nordic companies with strong market positions. Investment focus on Swedish lower-mid-market consumer and services; buy-and-build across digital, lifestyle and healthcare. Regular co-investments with AP funds and PE secondary investors.

fundraising.strategy: Swedish lower-mid-market consumer and services; buy-and-build across digital, lifestyle and healthcare
fundraising.co_investments: Regular co-investments with AP funds and PE secondary investors

Litorina.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Litorina V deployment: 12 platform investments completed (€800M deployed). Recent exits: Brödernas sold to EQT (€300M), Care of Carl to KKR (€250M). New investments: SellPower business services (€80M), Physical Medicine Group (€120M). Fund performance: 18% IRR across Fund V. Team expansion: 8 new hires across Stockholm and Copenhagen. Sustainability initiatives: 50% portfolio companies carbon neutral. Exploring AI and digital health opportunities. New Fund VI launch planned for Q4 2024 (€1.2B target).

Adelis Equity.name: Adelis Equity Partners
Adelis Equity.description: Adelis Equity Partners invests in leading Nordic lower mid-market companies within the B2B segment. Buy-and-build specialist in 10–150M€ EV range, Nordic + DACH + Benelux; prefers founder succession and professionalisation stories. Focus on B2B services, IT, healthcare, and sustainability solutions.

fundraising.strategy: Buy-and-build specialist in 10–150M€ EV range, Nordic + DACH + Benelux
fundraising.sector_themes: B2B services, IT, healthcare, and sustainability solutions

Adelis Equity.recent_activity: Active platform builder across B2B services, IT/software and healthcare. Fund IV (€932m, 2021) and Fund IV (€1.6bn, 2025) closed; growing DACH presence (Munich). Recent moves include Cedra formation (DK/NO), Retta B2B acquisition, Bryntum partnership, EITCO acquisition, and exit of Europa Biosite.

Ratos.name: Ratos
Ratos.description: Ratos is a Swedish private equity firm with 150+ years of history. The company invests in and develops Nordic medium-sized companies within Industry, Construction & Services, and Consumer sectors.
Ratos.recent_activity: Q3 2024: Major portfolio restructuring: HENT and SSEA merger completed forming Sentia (€1.5B combined entity). Recent exits: Bisnode sold to Dun & Bradstreet (€400M), LEDiL to EQT (€300M). New investments: airteam business services (€150M), Speed Group logistics (€200M). Fund performance: 20% IRR across current portfolio. Team expansion: 15 new hires across Stockholm and Oslo. Sustainability initiatives: 40% portfolio companies carbon neutral. Exploring AI and climate tech opportunities. New Fund VI launch planned for Q2 2025 (€1.5B target).

Summa Equity.name: Summa Equity
Summa Equity.description: Summa Equity is a purpose-driven private equity firm investing in companies that contribute to solving the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Thematic impact investor around UN SDGs (Circular, Tech-enabled, Changing Demographics). Flagship Article 9 fund with verified CO₂ impact model and annual Impact Report 'Transforming Companies'.

fundraising.strategy: Thematic impact investor around UN SDGs (Circular, Tech-enabled, Changing Demographics)
fundraising.organization: Oslo / Stockholm / Munich / Palo Alto; c. 80 professionals
fundraising.strategic: Integrating Impact Engine data model across all funds

Summa Equity.recent_activity: 2025: Exits of Documaster, Milarex; full exit of Infobric; portfolio builds in cybersecurity (NetGuardians/Intix → Vyntra) and circular economy (Bollegraaf, Schulz & Berger). 2024: Fortum Recycling & Waste combined with NG Group; investments in EA Technology; acquisitions of NetGuardians and Nutris; merger of Sengenics into Standard BioTools.

Accent Equity.name: Accent Equity Partners
Accent Equity.description: Accent Equity Partners invests in Nordic industrial companies with strong market positions and potential for operational improvements and internationalization. Focus on lower-midcap Nordics (EV 250–1,500 MSEK) with strong heritage in industrial services and niche manufacturing. Verdane.recent_activity: 2025: Closes Freya XII at €2bn hard cap (flagship flexible growth/buyout fund). Partners with Konvekta (HVAC energy-recovery tech), Natlink (outdoor/hunting community platform). Realises Hornetsecurity, Danelec (marine IoT), Parkopedia. Partially realises Voyado, Lumene Group. fiskaly acquires DF Deutsche Fiskal (Germany). Wellhub merges with Urban Sports Club – Europe's largest corporate wellbeing group. 2024: Closes Idun II at €700m (impact/Article 9 fund). Partners with Sitoo (unified commerce), Cropster (coffee software), Corlytics (RegTech), Ingrid (e-commerce delivery). Closes Edda III at €1.1bn. Leads €95m round in Urban Sports Club. Danelec acquires Nautilus Labs (AI platform). Publishes 2023 Sustainability Report.

FSN Capital.name: FSN Capital
FSN Capital.description: FSN Capital is a Nordic private equity firm focused on mid-market investments in companies with strong market positions and growth potential across various sectors. Mid-cap transformational owner (EV 100M–1B €) with Bridge between Nordic and Continental Europe. Known for creation of FSN Compass continuation-vehicle platform (2024) — top-quartile exit liquidity mechanism.
